titles.title: Pension Annuitants Protection Act of 1993
Pension Annuitants Protection Act of 1993
Pension Annuitants Protection Act of 1994
A bill to amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 in order to provide for the availability of remedies for certain former pension plan participants and beneficiaries.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9874)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Labor. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-443.
Senate Committee on Labor and Human Resources discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Labor-Management Relations.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and Labor
House Committee on Education and Labor

action.text: Mr. Williams moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/28/1993--Passed Senate amended. Pension Annuitants Protection Act of 1993 - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to provide that, in cases in which a pension plan fiduciary purchases insurance annuities in violation of ERISA, a court may award appropriate relief, including purchase of a back-up annuity.
